metadata.Title: CVE-2006-20001 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A carefully crafted If: request header can cause a memory read, or write of a single zero byte, in a pool (heap) memory location beyond the header value sent. This could cause the process to crash. This issue affects Apache HTTP Server 2.4.54 and earlier.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2006-20001` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.13
apache2-bin - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.13
apache2-data - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.13
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.13
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.13
apache2-utils - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.13
libapache2-mod-md - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.13
libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi - 2.4.41-4ubuntu3.13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.41-4ubuntu3.13').
